Comments_List: Analytical and language skills by reading a dense Chinese novel and interpreting its author's intentions in its historical setting.

The readings are all very insightful and thought-provoking, but I also wish we had smaller assignments throughout the term (like reading quizzes) so that the final paper isn't the only thing that determines the grade.
Yes but only if they are passionate about Chinese literature and history and would spend a great amount of their time reading through a sometimes very dense text.
For those who have a strong interest in Ming novels and who can read traditional literary Chinese, Yes.
